usefulItems: airtight container, wire rack, baking sheets, oven
title: Double Peanut Cookies

ingredients.content: 5 oz unsalted dry-roasted peanuts, divided, plus extra for decoration
4 oz unsalted butter, cold, cut into pieces, plus extra for greasing

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 325°F and grease two baking sheets and set aside.
Place 3 oz peanuts into mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>.
Add butter, sugar, light brown sugar, flour, egg, vanilla extract, baking soda and salt and mix <b>25 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add 2 oz peanuts and mix <b>15 sec//speed 3<b>. Scrape down mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further <b>15 sec//speed 3<b>. Dough will still look crumbly but will come together while shaping into balls. Roll cookies using 1 heaping tbsp of dough each (approx. 1 ½ in. wide) and place on greased baking sheets 2 in. apart. Place 1 peanut on top of each round, pressing slightly into dough.

Bake for 15-20 minutes (325°F) until golden and still slightly soft. Allow to rest on baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Once cool, store in an airtight container until ready to serve.

hintsAndTricks: These cookies are called Double Peanut Cookies because you make peanut butter first then add whole peanuts for decoration.
For 16 cookies shape dough into rounds (approx. 1.6 oz ea).
